h1: Calories in a Slice of Apple Pie
assumptions: Standard 1/8 slice of a 9-inch homemade apple pie with double crust, cinnamon-spiced apple filling, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, crust type, apple variety, sugar amount, and serving size. Check labels for commercial pies.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of apple pie contains about 411 calories, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of apple pie?
faqs.a: Approximately 411 calories for a standard 1/8 slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a slice of apple pie?
faqs.a: About 57 g total carbs, including 2 g fiber and 30 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is apple pie high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 19 g fat per slice, with 5 g saturated fat from the crust.

faqs.q: How does homemade vs. store-bought apple pie compare in calories?
faqs.a: Homemade can vary; store-bought often 400-500 kcal per slice due to added preservatives.

faqs.q: Can I make apple pie lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, use less sugar, single crust, or add fruits to reduce to under 300 kcal per slice.
